Detailed Description

Implementation class for scenario tool definition.

In vtkESQui a tool is considered an scenario object, so vtkScenarioObject serves as its base class.
This class serves as base class for specific surgical technique tools: vtkToolLaparoscopy, vtkToolEndovascular, etc...
As a vtkModel based class, at least a visualization model has to be defined. If the tool is deformable, a deformation and a collision model must also be defined.

See also:
InsertCollisions( vtkCollisionCollection* collisions )
bool vtkScenarioObject::IsDisabled ( ) [inline, inherited]

Check if object is disabled.

When an object is disabled it will NOT:

  • be visible.
  • be computed in collision detection.
  • be used in simulation.
bool vtkScenarioObject::IsEnabled ( ) [inline, inherited]

Check if object is visible.

When an object is enabled it will:

  • be visible.
  • be computed in collision detection.
  • be used in simulation.

The X parameter contains the relative movement in the horizontal axes

void vtkScenarioObject::RotateX ( double  x) [virtual, inherited]

Implements the lateral movements of the object (Local coordinate system)

The X parameter contains the relative movement in the horizontal axes

Parameters:
xx orientation angle Note: this function must be implemented in inheriting classes

Reimplemented in vtkToolEndovascular, vtkToolGrasper, vtkToolLaparoscopy, and vtkToolScissors.

void vtkScenarioObject::RotateY ( double  y) [virtual, inherited]

Implements the lateral movements of the object (Local coordinate system)

The Y parameter contains the relative movement in the vertical axes

Parameters:
yy orientation angle Note: this function must be implemented in inheriting classes

Reimplemented in vtkToolEndovascular, vtkToolGrasper, vtkToolLaparoscopy, and vtkToolScissors.

void vtkScenarioObject::RotateZ ( double  rotation) [virtual, inherited]

Rotate the object on its own axes (Local coordinate system)

This function rotate the object on its own axis the value of an angle given by the "Rotation" variable the rotation is produced acting on the actors who compose the object.

Parameters:
rotationrotation angle (radians) Note: this function must be implemented in inheriting classes

Reimplemented in vtkToolEndovascular, vtkToolGrasper, vtkToolLaparoscopy, and vtkToolScissors.

) [virtual, inherited]

Implements the translation of the object (Local coordinate system)

The X & Y parameters contains the relative movement in the horizontal and vertical axes respectively.

xx position of the object
yy position of the object
